page.title: 07ARTHUR GODDARD (1)
page.content: Arthur Goddard lives in a village called Fencott.He lives in a very old house and he has no electricily or gas.At night he lights a Victorian oil lamp and he cooks all his food on an old Victorian kitchen range.His house is very untidy from the outside and very interesting inside.When we went to visit him he told us some stories of when he was little and when he went to our school. One of the stories was that he walked to school every day and it was about three quarters of a mile. On very rainy days a horse and cart with a sort of sheet cover used to pick he and his sister up.Another story was that on Friday afternoon some of the boys out of his class that were eleven or over walked up to the Railway Halt on Mansmoor Lane and caught the train to Oxford.They had a woodwork lesson there.
